TopicTitle: Unable to get to starting screen

Articles.Content:
Good morning / afternoon. As of yesterday evening when I try to start KSP it goes through the first bit of loading, however when it gets to the point where it normally transitions to new game, load game and so forth the game instead immediately closes without any error message displayed. To this point I have deleted settings, reinstalled the game and restarted the computer without success at getting KSP to load. The error file in the present is

Unity Player [version: Unity 4.5.2f1_9abb1b59b47c]

KSP.exe caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)

in module KSP.exe at 001b:00cd60c8.

Error occurred at 2014-10-08_105638.

C:\Program Files\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP.exe, run by Paterson 1.

94% memory in use.

3072 MB physical memory [174 MB free].

0 MB paging file [1881 MB free].

2048 MB user address space [75 MB free].

Write to location 00000000 caused an access violation.

Context:

EDI: 0x00000000 ESI: 0x00000000 EAX: 0x00000000

EBX: 0x00000000 ECX: 0x00000000 EDX: 0x006f6e6f

EIP: 0x00cd60c8 EBP: 0x09b8fb4c SegCs: 0x0000001b

EFlags: 0x00010206 ESP: 0x09b8facc SegSs: 0x00000023

Bytes at CS:EIP:

89 14 81 8b 55 c4 01 55 dc 40 ff 4d d4 89 45 d0

My CPU is windows 8, 32-bit with 4G ram and a GTX 260 Video Card

Thanks for reading and any help would be appreciated.

edit: Here is the error file and system diagnostic

https://www.dropbox.com/s/gmfhd0m9i77cjsb/error.log?dl=0

https://www.dropbox.com/s/scy9atyylacfa2r/DxDiag.txt?dl=0

Edited October 8, 2014 by hirron
Welcome to the forums! The How to Get Support (READ FIRST) sticky will tell you what other information will help narrow down your problem.
Is there anything I am missing in this post or is it taking a long time to answer ?

It doesn't take long to answer why it crashes, you ran out of memory while loading

Be sure you have a completely clean install of 0.25, it's possible that if you use the patcher that you have duplicated parts folder and that can even happen when you didn't delete the KSP folder completely before re-installing via Steam.

If it still crashes after complete deletion of KSP folders and clean reinstall, then it's related to you running a 32bit OS and only having 2GB user-address space which would indicate misconfiguration. (LAA flag not set?) also called the /3GB flag but even if that flag were not set, you can only use 3GB of RAM on that machine, a single application can only access 2GB of ram.

Consider using an 64bit OS or set the /3GB flag (I have however no idea how to do that in Windows 8)

KSP needs more than 2GB of ram for itself. And you are for some reason running out of Ram in GENERAL. Closing applications that you don't need before starting KSP might also fix it. Like browsers, steam etc. They all use RAM, ram you have very little to actually use.
